required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Nicotine Lozenge in Relief of Provoked Acute Craving
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Nicotine Lozenge in Relief of Provoked Acute Craving

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to evaluate the ability of a nicotine lozenge to relieve craving for a cigarette compared to a matched placebo (a placebo is like sugar pill and contains no active).

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Nicotine Cravings VAS Scores in Light Smokers
primary_outcome.description: Participants completed a nicotine craving assessment consisting of following five items: I have a desire for a cigarette right now, if it were possible I would smoke right now, All I want right now is a cigarette, I have an urge for a cigarette, I crave a cigarette right now. All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). At the end of the craving assessment period, mean VAS score (in mm) was measured.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Nicotine Cravings VAS Scores in Heavy Smokers
primary_outcome.description: Participants completed a nicotine craving assessment consisting of following five items: I have a desire for a cigarette right now, if it were possible I would smoke right now, All I want right now is a cigarette, I have an urge for a cigarette, I crave a cigarette right now. All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). At the end of the craving assessment period, mean VAS score (in mm) was measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Responders With Improved Craving Scores in Heavy and Light Smokers Group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline prior to provoked craving paradigm, baseline post provoked craving paradigm
secondary_outcome.description: Responders were defined as participants with an increase of at least one point (on the 100 point VAS scale) from baseline prior to provoked craving paradigm (B1) to baseline post provoked craving paradigm (B2) on the average cravings score. Percentage of these responders was calculated to evaluate the provocation rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious AEs (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 0 minute, 60 minutes and 5 days post treatment
secondary_outcome.description: AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with study treatment/s. SAE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death; is life threatening; requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization results in disability/ incapacity; is a congenital anomaly/ birth defect.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Generally healthy smokers who smoke more than 5 cigarettes per day
- Body mass index (BMI) within the range 19-35 kilogram (kg)/meter (m)^2
- Females of childbearing potential who are, in the opinion of the investigator, practicing a reliable method of contraception.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are pregnant or who have a positive urine pregnancy test.
- Participants with known or suspected intolerance or hypersensitivity to the study materials (or closely related compounds) or any of their stated ingredients.
- Clinical Study/Experimental Medication: Participation in another clinical study or receipt of an investigational drug within 30 days of the screening visit.
- Prior Concomitant Medication: Treatment with enzyme altering agents (e.g. carbamazepine, phenytoin, cimetidine, sodium valporate) within 30 days of the craving provocation visit; Use of any prescription psychoactive medication (such as but not limited to antidepressants, antipsychotics, anxiolytics) within 14 days of the craving provocation visit; Participant has used an over-the-counter (OTC) medication such as antihistamines, sedating agents, or any compound that would have a sedating effect within 24 hours of the craving provocation visit; Current use of any nicotine replacement therapy.
- Substance abuse: Recent history or current history (within the last 1 year) of alcohol or other substance abuse.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited at the clinical site.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants who smoked more than 5 cigarettes per day were included in the study. Participants were stratified to treatments according to their smoking status: heavy smokers: smoking greater than 20 cigarettes per day and light smokers: smoking between 6 - 20 cigarettes per day.

group.title: Nicotine Lozenge 4 Milligrams (mg) (Heavy Smokers Group)
group.description: Participants smoking more than 20 cigarettes per day, received a single dose of 4mg nicotine lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Placebo Lozenge (Heavy Smokers Group)
group.description: Participants smoking more than 20 cigarettes per day, received a single dose of placebo lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Nicotine Lozenge 1.5mg (Light Smokers Group)
group.description: Participants smoking between 6-20 cigarettes per day, received a single dose of 1.5mg nicotine lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Placebo Lozenge (Light Smokers Group)
group.description: Participants smoking between 6-20 cigarettes per day, received a single dose of placebo lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Nicotine Lozenge 4 mg (Heavy Smokers Group)
group.description: Participants smoking more than 20 cigarettes per day, received a single dose of 4mg nicotine lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Placebo Lozenge 1 (Heavy Smokers Group)
group.description: Participants smoking more than 20 cigarettes per day, received a single dose of placebo lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Nicotine Lozenge 1.5mg (Light Smokers Group)
group.description: Participants smoking between 6-20 cigarettes per day, received a single dose of 1.5mg nicotine lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Placebo Lozenge 2 (Light Smokers Group)
group.description: Participants smoking between 6-20 cigarettes per day, received a single dose of placebo lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Nicotine cravings assessment baseline scores on a Visual Analogue scale (VAS)
measure.description: Participants were prohibited from smoking for 4 hours and then exposed to a provoked craving paradigm. During the provoked craving paradigm subjects were exposed to the sight and smell of a lit cigarette and were forbidden from putting the cigarette in their mouth. Cravings assessment was completed at the start of and immediately following the provoked craving paradigm using a VAS.

class.title: Baseline score prior provoked craving paradigm(B1)
Baseline score post provoked craving paradigm (B2)

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Nicotine Cravings VAS Scores in Light Smokers
outcome.description: Participants completed a nicotine craving assessment consisting of following five items: I have a desire for a cigarette right now, if it were possible I would smoke right now, All I want right now is a cigarette, I have an urge for a cigarette, I crave a cigarette right now. All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). At the end of the craving assessment period, mean VAS score (in mm) was measured.
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population: All randomized participants with at least one cravings assessment measurement post dose were analyzed. No data was imputed in case of dropouts or missing data.

group.title: Nicotine Lozenge 1.5mg (Light Smokers Group)
group.description: Participants smoking between 6-20 cigarettes/day, received a single dose of 1.5mg nicotine lozenge, through oral route.

group.title: Placebo Lozenge 2 (Light Smokers Group)
group.description: Participants smoking between 6-20 cigarettes/day, received a single dose of placebo lozenge, through oral route.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Nicotine Cravings VAS Scores in Light Smokers
measure.description: Participants completed a nicotine craving assessment consisting of following five items: I have a desire for a cigarette right now, if it were possible I would smoke right now, All I want right now is a cigarette, I have an urge for a cigarette, I crave a cigarette right now. All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). At the end of the craving assessment period, mean VAS score (in mm) was measured.
measure.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population: All randomized participants with at least one cravings assessment measurement post dose were analyzed. No data was imputed in case of dropouts or missing data.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered population means for treatments in comparison, to be equal with respect to provoked nicotine cravings at 1 minute post dosing.
analysis.estimate_desc: Treatment comparisons were made between nicotine 1.5mg lozenge and placebo lozenge at 5% significance level.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered population means for treatments in comparison, to be equal with respect to provoked nicotine cravings at 3 minute post dosing.
analysis.estimate_desc: Treatment comparisons were made between nicotine 1.5mg lozenge and placebo lozenge at 5% significance level.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered population means for treatments in comparison, to be equal with respect to provoked nicotine cravings at 5 minute post dosing.
analysis.estimate_desc: Treatment comparisons were made between 1.5mg nicotine lozenge and placebo lozenge at 5% significance level.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered population means for treatments in comparison, to be equal with respect to provoked nicotine cravings, 10 minutes post dosing.
analysis.estimate_desc: Treatment comparisons were made between 1.5mg nicotine lozenge and placebo lozenge at 5% significance level.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis considered population means for treatments in comparison, to be equal with respect to provoked nicotine cravings, 15 minutes post dosing.
analysis.estimate_desc: Treatment comparisons were made between 1.5mg nicotine lozenge and placebo lozenge at 5% significance level.

All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). All participants indicated their craving intensity on a pre-drawn 100 mm scale ranging from 0 (disagree) to 100 (agree). analysis.estimate_desc: Treatment comparisons were made between 4mg nicotine lozenge and placebo lozenge at 5% significance level.

analysis.estimate_desc: Treatment comparisons were made between 4mg nicotine lozenge and placebo lozenge at 5% significance level.

outcome.title: Percentage of Responders With Improved Craving Scores in Heavy and Light Smokers Group
outcome.description: Responders were defined as participants with an increase of at least one point (on the 100 point VAS scale) from baseline prior to provoked craving paradigm (B1) to baseline post provoked craving paradigm (B2) on the average cravings score. Percentage of these responders was calculated to evaluate the provocation rate.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline prior to provoked craving paradigm, baseline post provoked craving paradigm

group.title: Light Smokers Group
group.description: Participants smoking between 6-20 cigarettes per day at baseline and responded to nicotine craving provocative paradigm before treatment

group.title: Heavy Smokers Group
group.description: Participants smoking more than 20 cigarettes per day at baseline and responded to nicotine craving provocative paradigm before treatment

measure.title: Percentage of Responders With Improved Craving Scores in Heavy and Light Smokers Group
measure.description: Responders were defined as participants with an increase of at least one point (on the 100 point VAS scale) from baseline prior to provoked craving paradigm (B1) to baseline post provoked craving paradigm (B2) on the average cravings score. Percentage of these responders was calculated to evaluate the provocation rate.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious AEs (SAEs)
outcome.description: AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with study treatment/s. SAE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose results in death; is life threatening; requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization results in disability/ incapacity; is a congenital anomaly/ birth defect.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 0 minute, 60 minutes and 5 days post treatment
outcome.population: Safety population: All randomized participants who received the study treatments were considered evaluable for safety.

reported_events.time_frame: All AEs encountered or spontaneously reported following administration of any study treatment, and up to 5 days after the last administration of study treatment were recorded.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
